channel.title: Tim Videos Planet - Developers news - Category: GSOC-2014
channel.description: News from our best developers, all news aggregated by planet.

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 08/06/2014
item.description:
[code] Fixed prose.io configuration (I need to test it because I have some rare problems with adding tags for page with prose.io, but everything seems to work properly).

Plans for next week:
[code] Prepare new deploy script that will alert developers by email that deployment failed.
[code] Simplify process of adding new panel to page (create new liquid tag that will generate panel with selected settings (like width, classes, etc. with selected content from _includes folder)
[configuration/research] Find tool for monitor our websites if there are online (some type of Selenium tests but that run every 15 minutes and alert developers if something gone wrong)
[code] Add ability to publish news to social networks like Twitter or Google+

All task planned for this week has been ended, tomorrow I will write Week 3 Summary Post. :)
Thanks for great, 3rd week, all TimVideos members, Leon, Tim, and users. :)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: 8 June '14
item.description:
• I implemented location detection in my app today using pygeoip.
  • I detected user network bandwidth by downloading an image at a URL using JS and timing it. This method gives network speed fairly close to as measured by other online speedtests.
  • I toyed with html2canvas and implemented a dummy.
  • I was wondering about the possible options we have for storing the generated client-end screenshots. I talked to skay and we came up with the following:

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 07/06/2014
item.description:
Planet (planet.timvideos.us):

[code] Added dynamically loading posts with AJAX on planet.timvideos.us (created JSON generator for creating easy source for Javascript)
[code] HTML fixes on planet.timvideos.us (some tags were not closed, modern browsers can handle that situation, but on older it caused some errors)
[code] Added RSS generators by category and tags
[code] Added OPML and RSS icon with ability to download feeds

Getting Started (currently on pinoss.github.io):

[code] Finished adapting current content to new layout
[code] Added RSS icon with ability to download feeds from planet
[code] Added news as a tab on website (iframe with content from planet.timvideos.us)

item.title: 6 June '14
item.description:
I initialized a new git repo from the 2-scoops-of-django template. Messed with the javascript and templates a bit. Got a feel of the environment. Also got to learn more about virtualenv and usage. The repo is initialized with Django 1.6.5.

Originally posted on Niharika Kohli

item.title: Videotest component ported
item.description: An important requirement, gst-python1.0 is not available for Ubuntu 12.04 precise in the Gstreamer developers PPA so I compiled it from source. This provided overrides that were missing in my system and this solved various problems including Gst.Fraction (previous blog post) and Gst.TIME_ARGS (that I had implemented myself).

item.title: Problems with Gst.Fraction
item.description: There is a Fraction class I need to port but I’m facing a few problems.

item.title: GSoC Update 6-3
item.description: Snippets

item.title: How to run tests?
item.description: Running all the tests in module was broken due to mixing of gobject and gi. So, I’ve created a working-tests.txt and a run_tests.sh to read this file and run the tests. As a result, Travis build is passing now as seen on badge on sidebar of this blog.

item.title: GSoC Update 6-2
item.description: Snippets

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 03/06/2014
item.description:
Unfortunately and suddenly I had to prepare project for Artificial Intelligence classes and I spend most of the day working on that project. Tomorrow I hope my project will be accepted and I will be 100% focused on GSoC project.

[community] hangout talk with my mentor (great idea!)
[research] read links from Tim
[research] tried to find best monitoring tool to check if website is working, I found great post about that tools (http://www.hongkiat.com/blog/monitor-website-up-downtime-30-free-web-services-and-tools/), I am thinking about simple 'ping' application to check if server responds correctly, but it's more important to has some tests if all functionality on website is working (selenium, that runs online (like every 10-30 minutes) and send alerts if tests failed
[research] reflections about deploy plugin. After talk with Leon, we both came to conclusion that scripts written in bash are too simple and are hard to maintain. So I think that we should use ruby/python/perl script to run the deploy, and if something went wrong it will be sending alerts to email.

Plans for rest of the week do not change, I will have more time on weekend and I will end all tasks planned for this week and I hope at the beginning of the next week you will see new version of code.timvideos.us.
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: Week 2 Progress
item.description: I continued with the porting of base dependency modules not covered in previous week. To fix the failing tests, I ported boot.py first which led to tests for other modules passing again. After this, I ported pygobject.py and feeder.py followed by padmonitor.py where I faced some problems due to version 1.2.1 of Gstreamer. This is the latest available version in Ubuntu 12.04 precise. I fixed these by implementing some changes manually.

item.title: [GSoC] What hapenned during this week (week 2)
item.description:
That was great week, I've learnt a lot and did some code and prepared small website that is already online: http://planet.timvideos.us, but before I did that I spend some time with creating mockups and design for timvideos.us websites. I think I have created something that looks good, is unique and fit into TimVideos community needs.

Currently I spend my time working on design for current content, that is not easy, because I need to think how to fit new design into old content and I also need to think about the future: New design should work good with new content too, I hope that I will prepare something that everyone will like.

During this week I've also updated Jekyll from 0.21 to 2.0 and every plugins that was used on current solution I had to rewrite. I've added prose.io as a content editor for website, but I also noticed that GitHub offers now great content editor out-of-the-box and many people uses GitHub editor instead of prose.io.
Working with prose.io wasn't easy, I've had to deploy small application on Heroku (called Gatekeeper) to authenticate to GitHub account, I've had some bugs like redirection errors, or routing errors, but I resolved them and prose.io works almost correctly (I am saying almost, because of problems with configuration, local prose.io doesn't want to load prose.yml file from repository to load all settings for editor.

I've written also a lot of small plugins for Jekyll and that was the biggest and greatest fun, Jekyll is really easy to extend and writing plugins is very simple and can be done in many ways. That makes every developer happy. :)

I've prepared planet.timvideos.us page, I've added there my custom theme, added categories, and tags. I've added also GitHub activities, avatars fetched from GitHub accounts. I've written an automatic generate script, which runs every minute and updates the planet.timvideos.us. I've prepared 2 generators: OPML generator and iFrame generator, to provide feed in opml and site without sidebar (only news).

Also I've started to using Producteev to manage project and make sure that everything is realized according to plan.

I've learnt a lot from Tim, my mentor Leon and whole community, thank you guys. :)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.description: Snippets for today

item.title: 1 June '14
item.description: Skay told me that a Django-based form would be preferable to an HTML one, so today I’m going to make the form properly, in Django.

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 01/06/2014
item.description:
[code] created iFrame generator (now you can see page without sidebars simply by adding /iframe/ at the beginning of the address (planet.timvideos.us/iframe), that will be used in code.timvideos.us to show news
[code] some css fixes on mobile devices, I've had to change overflow of elements to remove strike out effect on header element
[code] added theme from planet.timvideos.us to code.timvideos.us, started to adapting current content to new theme

Plans for tomorrow/next week:
[code] working on theme on planet.timvideos.us
[code] fix prose.io and configure to work properly
[code] add iframe from planet.timvideos.us as a part of the website
[code] add feed download from planet.timvideos.us in code.timvideos.us

Tomorrow I'll write week summary post about progress in GSoC project.

That was great week, I had so much fun with Jekyll and learnt a lot about plugins, how jekyll works, and about bootstrap and design too, I read a lot of nice articles on Smashing Magazine, lots of forums about bash, and that is only the beginning of GSoC project. I can't wait for more challenges.

Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer
